model

Class DBTablePrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.DBTablePrinter

  • public class DBTablePrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    Just a utility to print rows from a given DB table or a ResultSet to standard out, formatted to look like a table with rows and columns with borders.

    Stack Overflow website (stackoverflow.com) was the primary source of inspiration and help to put this code together. Especially the questions and answers of the following people were very useful:

    Question: How to display or print the contents of a database table as is
    People: sky scraper

    Question: System.out.println() from database into a table
    People: Simon Cottrill, Tony Toews, Costis Aivali, Riggy, corsiKa

    Question: Simple way to repeat a string in java
    People: Everybody who contributed but especially user102008

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CATEGORY_BOOLEAN
      Column type category for BOOLEAN columns.
      static int CATEGORY_DATETIME
      Column type category for date and time related columns like DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP etc.
      static int CATEGORY_DOUBLE
      Column type category for REAL, DOUBLE, and DECIMAL columns.
      static int CATEGORY_INTEGER
      Column type category for TINYINT, SMALLINT, INT and BIGINT columns.
      static int CATEGORY_OTHER
      Column type category for types for which the type name will be printed instead of the content, like BLOB, BINARY, ARRAY etc.
      static int CATEGORY_STRING
      Column type category for CHAR, VARCHAR and similar text columns.
      private static int DEFAULT_MAX_ROWS
      Default maximum number of rows to query and print.
      private static int DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH
      Default maximum width for text columns (like a VARCHAR) column.

    • Method Detail

      • printTable

        public static java.lang.String printTable(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                          java.lang.String tableName)
        Overloaded method that stores rows from table tableName in a string using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to DEFAULT_MAX_ROWS and DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
        Parameters:
        conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
        tableName - Name of the database table
        Returns:
        A String containing the data of the table

      • printTable

        public static java.lang.String printTable(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                          java.lang.String tableName,
                                          int maxRows)
        Overloaded method that stores rows from table tableName in a string using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to maxRows and DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
        Parameters:
        conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
        tableName - Name of the database table
        maxRows - Number of max. rows to query and print
        Returns:
        A String containing the data of the table

      • printTable

        public static java.lang.String printTable(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                          java.lang.String tableName,
                                          int maxRows,
                                          int maxStringColWidth)
        Overloaded method that stores rows from table tableName in a string using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to maxRows and maxStringColWidth will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
        Parameters:
        conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
        tableName - Name of the database table
        maxRows - Number of max. rows to query and print
        maxStringColWidth - Max. width of text columns
        Returns:
        A String containing the data of the table

      • printResultSet

        public static java.lang.String printResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Overloaded method to store rows of a ResultSet in a string using DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH to limit the width of text columns.
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet to print
        Returns:
        A String containing the data of the ResultSet

      • printResultSet

        public static java.lang.String printResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                              int maxStringColWidth)
        Overloaded method to store rows of a ResultSet in a string using DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH to limit the width of text columns.
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet to print
        maxStringColWidth - Max. width of text columns
        Returns:
        A String containing the data of the ResultSet

      • whichCategory

        private static int whichCategory(int type)
        Takes a generic SQL type and returns the category this type belongs to. Types are categorized according to print formatting needs:

        Integers should not be truncated so column widths should be adjusted without a column width limit. Text columns should be left justified and can be truncated to a max. column width etc...

        See also: java.sql.Types
        Parameters:
        type - Generic SQL type
        Returns:
        The category this type belongs to
